intro: Costus rurrenabaqueanus, commonly known as the Rurrenabaque costus, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of Bolivia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers, and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical inflorescence. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
